subject: Better.

 Tuner with white noise running. There's a little noise pick up, but I had=
 the antenna wire runing very close to the RVG section.  Afterward I replac=
ed the antenna wire with coax to prevent noise pick up from inside the box.=
 Oh yeah, manual tuing. 
 
 I know! There's noisy crappy boxes out there, a=
nd I should have done this testing long ago, but so many wanted to be like =
Chris Moon, and I wanted to get the boxes out there so others could experie=
nce it, and experiment, but they function so poorly as yet, and no one gets=
 anything close to what I do, or what Moon claims. So the TAPS article was =
correct about the things being flawed, but I'm working on it. I don't sell =
the stuff, and never have, so all we've lost is time. I can't make many of =
these, I can handle making them to test, and improve the thing, but I dread=
 just having to wire and wire and build and build endlessly. I can't do tha=
t stuff anymore, just too brain fried. 
 
 The fact is, there are other met=
hods that work as well, and probably better. Often the voices are much clea=
rer with the simple methods, and they can be shared since most can hear the=
m. I am endlessly discouraged when I think I have a perfectly clear voice f=
rom the box, and not another person in the world can hear it. 
 
 Frank-S

 Tuner with white noise running. There's a little noise pi=
ck up, but I had the antenna wire runing very close to the RVG section=
.  Afterward I replaced the antenna wire with coax to prevent noise pi=
ck up from inside the box. Oh yeah, manual tuing. <BR>
 <BR>
 I k=
now! There's noisy crappy boxes out there, and I should have done this test=
ing long ago, but so many wanted to be like Chris Moon, and I wanted to get=
 the boxes out there so others could experience it, and experiment, but the=
y function so poorly as yet, and no one gets anything close to what I =
do, or what Moon claims. So the TAPS article was correct about the things b=
eing flawed, but I'm working on it. I don't sell the stuff, and never have,=
 so all we've lost is time. I can't make many of these, I can handle making=
 them to test, and improve the thing, but I dread just having to wire and w=
ire and build and build endlessly. I can't do that stuff anymore, just too =
brain fried. <BR>
 <BR>
 The fact is, there are other methods tha=
t work as well, and probably better. Often the voices are much clearer with=
 the simple methods, and they can be shared since most can hear them. I am =
endlessly discouraged when I think I have a perfectly clear voice from=
 the box, and not another person in the world can hear it. <BR>
